data.title: Jilson Olen Gilbert (abt.1800-1852)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Jilson Gilbert born abt. 1800 Spartanburg, Spartanburg, South Carolina, United States died 1852 Gadsen, Etowah, Alabama, United States including ancestors + descendants + 1 genealogist comments + Y-chromosome DNA + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 13 Mar 2024 | Created 13 Jul 2020

This page has been accessed 499 times.

Contents

1 Biography

1.1 Children

1.2 COURT RECORDS

2 Research Notes

3 Sources

Biography

This profile is part of the Gilbert Name Study.

Jilson Olen Gilbert (Sr) was born abt. 1800/01, in Spartanburg, Spartanburg County, South Carolina, he died 1 Jul 1852 in Gadsden, Etowah County, Alabama, and was buried at the Old Harmony Baptist Church cemetery in Rainbow City, Etowah, Alabama.[1][2]

Jilson Gilbert married 6 Apr 1822 in Ashville, St. Clair County, AL, Elizabeth Allemon [Alberson, sic.] Ellison (1805 Georgia,-28 Mar 1847 Rainbow City, Etowah County, Alabama) [3] [4] - The Old Harmony Baptist Church records indicate that Elizabeth Gilbert died in childbirth. She is buried in the church cemetery. The child, named Gilson, survived and was placed with Jilson O. Gilbert’s brother, Henry Calphy Gilbert to raise. Henry moved to Arkansas where, in a few years, the boy died. (Census records indicate that Gilson Gilbert was in the household of Jilson O Gilbert’s brother, Henry Calphy Gilbert)

About 1847, Jilson married his second wife, Susannah "Susan" Gore (8 Jan 1812 Alabama-13 Jul 1881Parker County, Texas). She is buried at Soda Springs Cemetery, Parker County, Texas.[5]

Susan became the mother of Mary Victoria Lorinda Gilbert (Phillips) and William Benson "Billy" Gilbert.[6]

1 Jul 1852 - Jilson O Gilbert (Sr) died and was buried at the Old Harmony Baptist Church cemetery. There was a division of the property consisting of land and a store. About $4500. was divided among fourteen heirs.

Following his 1852 death, Jilson Gilbert’s surviving wife, Susan Gore, moved to Texas with her children.

Children

(all born in Alabama)[7][8][9]

Phamey Elizabeth Gilbert Littlefield (1823–12 Jan 1891 Parker County, Texas [10]

George Webster Gilbert (8 Mar 1826 AL - 18 Oct 1901 Parker County TX) [11] M-3 Feb 1844 AL/ 1-Melissa Littlefield;M-22 Oct 1853 AL/2-Mary Mills (19 Mar 1829-20 Oct 1879)

Mary Jane Gilbert Littlefield (Oct 1828 AL - 1 Aug 1899 Parker County TX) M-7 Feb 1843 AL/ Samuel Littlefield

Sylvester Gilbert (1829- ) Killed by Indians in Eastland County, Texas. Date uncertain.

James Madison Gilbert (12 Mar 1830 AL - 30 Jan 1912 Palo Pinto County TX) M-19 Aug 1862 AL/Antonia Ann Irvin (29 Jun 1836-2 Feb 1910)

Lemuel Jasper Gilbert (1833–1869)

Cansada Gilbert Ellison (c.1835 AL- ) M-30 Dec 1853 AL/ Francis M Ellison (30 Mar 1835)

Emily Gilbert Ellison (11 Jan 1838 AL - 16 Jun 1902 Parker County TX) M-AL/ Jesse E Ellison (29 May 1830-16 Dec 1900)

Almoth Byers Gilbert (1 Jan 1840 AL - 16 Dec 1919 Parker County TX) M-7 Jan 1861 TX/ Mary Jane Hill (14 Feb 1840-20 Feb 1909)

Thomas W Gilbert (20 Dec 1842 AL - 21 Feb 1890 Parker County TX) M-1877 TX?/ Dortha Sue “Dolly” Wharton

Aaron (Orren?) Taylor “A R” Gilbert (1843 AL - 24 Feb 1923 Palo Pinto County TX) M/ Betty Elizabeth Ellison (5 May 1846-23 Feb 1910)

Gilson Gilbert (c.18 Mar 1847, St. Clair County, Alabama, d. July 27, 1864, General Hospital at Little Rock, Arkansas.) (taken into the family of Henry Calphy Gilbert) Perhaps died in the Civil War, See this record[12]

Mary Victoria Lorinda Gilbert Phillips (18 Sep 1849 AL - 9 Jan 1909 Parker County TX) M-18 Nov 1875(6?) AL/William Lewis Phillips[13]

William Benson Gilbert, (Born 1 Feb 1852 in St. Clair, Alabama-died 24 Jan 1918 Parker County, Texas).[FAG MEMORIAL ID 41276541] Married -5 Apr 1877 AL/ Mary Elizabeth Jane Mintz. [possibly an identity problem here, the 1918 death cert.[14] for W. Benson Gilbert shows his mother as Susanah Bis (Dale) Gilbert born S.C.],

Jilson Gilbert was a deacon in the Old Harmony Baptist Church near Gadsden (Rainbow City), St Clair (now Etowah) County, Alabama. He helped organize and build the first church.

COURT RECORDS

14 Oct 1834 – USA General Land Office Patent Certificate #5779: Jilson Gilbert of St Clair County, Alabama – NE part of the SE part of fractional section 36 in Township 12 of Range 6E in the District of Lands subject to sale at Huntsville, Alabama containing 30.25 acres. /s/Andrew Jackson by A J Donelson Sec’y, Elijah Hayward Commissioner.

11 Jul 1857 – James Gore [brother of Susan Gore, second wife of Jilson O Gilbert] appointed guardian of Lorinda Gilbert and William B Gilbert, minor heirs of Gilson Gilbert, deceased, with William Gore Sr and Hosea L Pettit. Bond for $800.[15]

On 3 May 1859 in St Clair County Ala., Thomas W. Gilbert (believed brother of Henry C. and Jilson O.) was made "guardian of Alemeth Gilbert, Thomas Gilbert, Orren Gilbert, and Jilson Gilbert minor heirs of the estate of Jilson Gilbert deceased...".[16]

Thos W Gilbert, guardian of the estates of Alemeth Gilbert, Thomas Gilbert, Orren Gilbert, and Jilson Gilbert, minor heirs of the estate of Jilson Gilbert, dec’d, came into court and filed his account and vouchers for annual settlement of his guardianship and the court having examined the same found the same appraise correct reports said accounts and vouchers for allowances and settlement on the 2nd Monday in May next and said day is now by the Court set for said settlement further ordered that notice of said settlement be given by posting of written notices one at the Court House door and three other public places in the County for at least three successive weeks prior to said day notifying all persons interested in said Settlement of the time and place of making the same so that all who may think proper may then appear at the Court house in Ashville and contest the Same if Court consenting be (?) and he is hereby appointed Guardian adlitern (?) to protect the interests of said Alemeth, Thomas, Orren, and Jilson Gilbert on said settlement. /s/ Ross Philips Judge of Probate.

3 May 1859 – St Clair County, Alabama Will Book A:187: Thomas W Gilbert, guardian of Alemeth Gilbert, Thomas Gilbert, Orren Gilbert, and Jilson Gilbert minor heirs of the estate of Jilson Gilbert deceased and filed in court his supplemental report showing the amount of assets which he has received for said wards form the administration of the Estate of Sylvester Gilbert deceased. Ordered by the court that same be recorded and filed for future reference. /s/ Ross Philips Judge of Probate.

Research Notes

Jilson, or Gilson as it often appears in records, is an unusual name and not previously seen in the Spartanburg Daniel Gilbert Sr. line. It looks like a surname. Often in the 18th and 19th century south, sons were given maiden names of their mother, or grandmother, as a given name. This could be a clue in identifying Jilson's mother's maiden name, or that of a grandmother.

Fact: Also Known As Gilson Olen Gilbert

Fact: Residence (1840, 1850) St. Clair, Alabama,

Emily 13f, AL (Emily Gilbert Ellison 1838–1902)

Almoth 11, AL (Almoth Byers Gilbert 1840–1919)

↑ "Civil War record provided by Jonathan N. Johnson: microfilm Roll 36 of NARA film M399 (lookup provided by Edward G. Gerdes - egerdes_at_insolwwb.net): GILBERT, JILSON Pvt Co G, 4th AR Cav (US) was born at St Clair County AL, Age 18, ht 5' 7", eyes blue, hair lt, complx fair. He enlisted 6 Feb 1864 at Pine Bluff, AR and was mustered into service 24 Feb 1864. He died of chronic diarrhea at the General Hospital at Little Rock AR 27 Jul 1864."

↑ Mary Victoria Lorinda Gilbert Phillips Find A Grave: Memorial #42720375
